project.name: ember-indexeddb
project.description: A utility for using IndexedDB with ember & ember-data

Ember Data.name: Ember Data

Services.name: Services
Services.description:
Available services to use.
 Overwrite IndexedDbConfiguration to fit your application.

Utils.name: Utils

Usage.name: Usage
Usage.description:
This addon provides utilities to work with IndexedDB based on [Dexie](http://dexie.org/).
 It provides:
* A service to configure the database & migrations/upgrades
 * A service to interact with the database
 * An ember-data adapter for IndexedDB
 * Test helpers
This set of utilities makes it possible to query data from an API, put it into IndexedDB,
 and work with a local database for full offline capabilities.
## Installation
 ```shell
 ember install ember-indexeddb
 ```
## Changelog
 Changelog can be found [here](https://github.com/mydea/ember-indexeddb/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)

## Looking for help?
 If it is a bug [please open an issue on GitHub](http://github.com/mydea/ember-indexeddb/issues).

classitems.description:
Map a payload to a database table.
This will use the function provided in mapTable to get a payload to insert into IndexedDB.
Returns null if no map function is found for the type.
classitems.name: mapItem

params.name: type
params.description: The type of object to map

classitems.description: Setup the database and do all necessary database migrations.

classitems.description:
Cleanup a json object.
This will convert array-like structures to actual arrays for saving.
It will strip out meta properties etc.
classitems.name: _cleanObject

classitems.description: Convert a property to a string.
classitems.name: _toString

classitems.description:
Convert a boolean to 1/0.
Optionally, you can specify the value that should be used if the given value does not exist in the payload.
For example, if you want that a given value should be 1 if not found in the payload, use `this._toZeroOne(value, 1)`.
classitems.name: _toZeroOne

params.name: noneValue
params.description: The value to use if val is null/undefined.

classitems.description: The actual Dexie database.

classitems.description:
The database name to use.
Overwrite this if you want to use something different.
classitems.name: databaseName

classitems.description:
If set to true, it will output which indecies are used for queries.
This can be used to debug your indecies.
classitems.name: _shouldLogQuery

classitems.description:
This is an object with an array per model type.
It holds all the objects per model type that should be bulk saved.
After actually saving, this will be cleared.
classitems.name: _saveQueue

classitems.description:
This is the test waiter used to ensure all promises are resolved in tests.
This is set by the this._registerTestWaiter() method.
classitems.name: _testWaiter

classitems.description:
This is a promise that is used for bulk saving.
All bulkSave() operations use and return the same promise, which is cached here.
classitems.name: _savePromise

classitems.description:
All currently running promises are temporarily saved here.
This is used to check if there are running transactions.
classitems.name: _promiseQueue

classitems.description:
e.g. MS Edge doesn't support compound indices.
For these cases, querying shouldn't try to use them.
classitems.name: _supportsCompoundIndicies

classitems.description:
Call this and wait until it resolves before doing anything with IndexedDB!
This should be done in beforeModel() on the application route.
It will reject if IndexedDB is not available.

Also available as a task: `indexedDb.setupTask.perform()`
classitems.name: setup

classitems.description:
Query indexedDB.
This uses _buildQuery under the hood.
This resolved to an array.
classitems.name: query

classitems.description:
Query indexedDB.
This uses _buildQuery under the hood.
This resolved to an object.
classitems.name: queryRecord

classitems.description:
Find one or multiple items by id.
If id is an array, this will try to fetch all of these objects and resolve with an array.
Otherwise, it will resolve with an object.
classitems.name: find

params.name: id
params.description: One or multiple ids to fetch

classitems.description: Add one or multiple items to the database.

classitems.name: save

params.name: type
params.description: The model type of the object

Drop the entire database.

Also available as a task: `indexedDb.dropDatabaseTask.perform()`

exportDatabase

Import a complete database dump as created by this.exportDatabase()

Also available as a task: `indexedDb.importDatabaseTask.perform()`

params.name: config
params.description: A configuration object as created by this.exportDatabase()

classitems.description:
Wait for all queued objects ot be resolved.
This will resolve when there are no open processes anymore.

Also available as a task: `indexedDb.waitForQueueTask.perform()`
classitems.name: waitForQueue

classitems.description: Get the queue and save everything in it in bulk.
classitems.name: _bulkSave

classitems.description:
Build a query for Dexie.

This will try to find a matching index, and use it if possible.
It can also handle multi-indecies, if they have been specified and are supported.
If no matching index is found, it will fetch everything and try to filter it via JS.
Note that this is _much_ slower than querying by actual indecies, so you should definitely use that if possible!
If you are using multiple query arguments, and only one of them is found as index, it will query the database by this index
and then do the other queries via JS filter.

Note that this will also auto-convert boolean query arguments to 1/0.
classitems.name: _buildQuery

classitems.description:
Add a promise to the promise queue.
When the promise resolves or rejects, it will be removed from the promise queue.
classitems.name: _addToPromiseQueue

classitems.description: Deep-clone an object.
classitems.name: cloneDeep

classitems.description: Save this model, but try to save it together with other objects
classitems.name: saveBulk

classitems.description: Manually mark the model as saved.
classitems.name: _markAsSaved

classitems.description: Manually mark the model as having an error.
classitems.name: _markAsError
